author: Nick Sommerlad
title: Major Tory donor arrested over alleged £100million VAT scam - and faces extradition to Germany
text:
A picture on Virdee's website of him with Rihanna Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A businessman facing extradition to Germany over an alleged £100million VAT scam is a major Tory donor, the Daily Mirror can reveal. 
Peter Singh Virdee, 43, was arrested at Heathrow Airport by officers from the Met’s extradition unit on Tuesday. 
His firm B&S Properties has gifted £98,000 to the Tories since 2011 and Virdee was invited to a meal with a senior minister and other donors in 2012. 
German prosecutors allege Virdee was one of the “central organisers” of a criminal plot to defraud authorities of VAT on carbon credits under the EU Emissions Trading Scheme. 
Carbon credits are tradeable permits for nations or firms to produce a certain amount of emissions. 
The Sikh tycoon worked “in the background” and took pains to conceal his identity, prosecutors claim. Virdee meeting the Queen 
He faces up to 15 years in jail for alleged fraud and evasion of 125 million euros – £109million – in VAT, if found guilty. 
Virdee, a visiting professor at Manchester Metropolitan University, denies the allegations. 
A Metropolitan Police spokesman said: “Peter Singh Virdee, 43, a UK national, was arrested on Tuesday, January 10, at Heathrow Airport. He was arrested on a European arrest warrant on behalf of authorities in Germany, where he is wanted in relation to tax evasion.” Virdee appeared before Westminster magistrates court last week and was granted bail. 
Carter-Ruck, the legal firm representing Virdee, said: “Our client categorically denies these allegations; he has never been involved in carbon trading let alone any kind of fraud. He poses with Al Pacino 
“While he is happy to co-operate with the authorities he intends to defend himself fully against these allegations and the attempts to extradite him.” 
The firm said the investigation was six years old and Virdee was “surprised” German authorities wanted his extradition. It said the only basis for the allegations was “a statement given by a convicted fraudster who entered some form of plea bargain in return for implicating other people”. 
Virdee’s firms made five separate donations to the Tories between 2011 and 2014. Party records show Virdee was one of the “Major Donors who attended a Leader’s Group event featuring a meal and with a Minister in attendance” between July and September 2012. 
The senior Tory ministers who attended the events in that period were David Cameron , George Osborne and Greg Barker, the former Prime Minister, Chancellor and Energy Minister. 
Virdee’s website details his charity work and features a series of photos of him meeting the Queen and Prince Philip, athlete Usain Bolt, singer Rihanna and actors Al Pacino and Mickey Rourke. Like us on Facebook
